basics.name: Alexandre St-Aubin
basics.summary: MSc student in Computer Science at The University of British Columbia. Research interests include Reinforcement Learning for Robotics, Computer Vision, and Lifelong Learning.

work.company: Mila - Quebec AI Institute, Complex Data Lab
work.summary: Worked under Professors Reihaneh Rabbany and Jean-François Godbout. Conducted research on the societal/political impact of deepfakes and evaluated state-of-the-art diffusion models.

work.company: McGill University, Centre for Intelligent Machines
work.summary: Conducted research in long-horizon motion control of robotic arms supervised by Prof. Hsiu-Chin Lin. Developed a method for single-shot learning of manipulation tasks.

work.company: McGill University, Dept. of Mathematics and Statistics
work.summary: Engaged in a machine learning study and conducted a research project on Supervised Machine Learning.
Event photography across all Montreal Universities.

work.company: Institut de la Statistique du Québec (ISQ)
work.summary: Developed a VBA application for survey estimation, analyzed open-ended responses, and contributed to provincial research studies (QHSHSS).

education.area: Master of Science in Computer Science

awards.title: University of Waterloo financial support (Offer rejected)
awards.awarder: David R. Cheriton School of Computer Science

awards.title: Science Undergraduate Research Award (SURA)
awards.summary: Research funding for full-time research activities. Amount: 8,700 CAD

publications.name: Single-Shot Learning of Stable Dynamical Systems for Long-Horizon Manipulation Tasks
publications.summary: St-Aubin, A., Abyaneh, A. and Lin, H.-C. A novel method for single-shot learning of long-horizon manipulation tasks.

publications.name: An Introduction to Supervised Machine Learning
publications.summary: Report generated during the Directed Reading Program at McGill University.

teaching.description: Hold office hours to answer questions from students and coordinate a team of undergraduate TAs for test grading. Program the bi-weekly quizzes on prairielearn.
Graded the assignments of honours students.

portfolio.name: Improving Drotrack (COMP 558)
portfolio.description: Enhanced the performance of a 2020 drone-based tracking paper by implementing techniques like Kalman filters, optical flow, and ORB features.

portfolio.name: Applied Machine Learning Projects (COMP 551)
portfolio.description: Emotion classification using LLMs, Regularization and model evaluation, Classification of image data with MLPs and CNNs.

portfolio.name: Image Deblurring (MATH 563)
portfolio.description: Deblurred images by implementing convex optimization algorithms such as Spingarn's Method, Primal-dual Douglas Rachford Splitting, ADMM, and Chambolle-Pock in Matlab.
